Articles.Content:
Hi,

The game's choice of initial camera position when going EVA in space seems always to be on the opposite side of the spacecraft from the Kerbal. It would be interesting to know whether others find this happening, and what the possible reason may be. Is it intentional?

Similarly, when launching from Kerbin the game's initial choice of camera position when switching to map mode is nearly always on the opposite side of Kerbin.

I wonder what the algorithm is for making these camera positions.
I’m pretty sure it faces the Kerbals face

1 hour ago, Tsar_bomba said:

I’m pretty sure it faces the Kerbals face

Ah, yes, that fits what happens.

The opposite rule, facing the same way as the Kerbal, would seem to make more sense to me, obviating the 180° camera move I always have to make. But perhaps that's a minority opinion.

12 minutes ago, dudnees said:

Ah, yes, that fits what happens.

The opposite rule, facing the same way as the Kerbal, would seem to make more sense to me, obviating the 180° camera move I always have to make. But perhaps that's a minority opinion.

I found it confusing when I first started playing the game. You're planning to do an EVA. You rotate the spacecraft so that the hatch is illuminated by the sun. You click the EVA button and the game puts you on the opposite side of the spacecraft from the Kerbal, hiding her, and leaving you facing into the Sun. What? Where's the Kerbal?
For all I know it could be relics from an attempt at multiplayer from beta. It may just be easier to face the camera that way, but I don’t know.
